alert.note: Alert for Box Butte; Cheyenne; Morrill; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 22 at 4:14AM CST until February 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow ending, with a continued period of extremely dangerous wind chills. Additional accumulations generally less than one inch. Wind chills as low as 40 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Morrill, Box Butte, and southern Sioux Counties in the Nebraska Panhandle including Bridgeport, Alliance, Hemingford, and Agate. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in 5 minutes or less. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. In addition, some roadways may be slick or snow covered do to snow showers in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of light snow is possible late Tuesday night through Wednesday. Additional accumulations of 1 to 3 inches will be possible.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, knit hat, and mittens.

area.areaDesc: Box Butte; Cheyenne; Morrill; South Sioux
